title: Arulmigu Meenakshi Sundareswarar Temple
summary: Arulmigu Meenakshi Sundareswarar Temple, also known as Arulmigu Meenakshi Amman Thirukkovil, is a historic Hindu temple located in Madurai, Tamil Nadu, India. It is dedicated to Goddess Meenakshi (a form of Parvati), her consort Sundareśvarar (a form of Shiva), and her brother Aḻagar (a form of Vishnu). The temple is theologically significant for its confluence of Shaivism, Shaktism, and Vaishnavism. It is central to the ancient city of Madurai, mentioned in Tamil Sangam literature and 6th-century CE texts, and is one of the Paadal Petra Sthalams. Its west tower serves as the model for the Tamil Nadu State Emblem. Key constructions were undertaken by Pandyan Emperor Sadayavarman Kulasekaran I (1190-1205 CE) and subsequent Pandyan rulers like Maravarman Sundara Pandyan I and II.
key_points: A historic Hindu temple located in Madurai, Tamil Nadu, India.
Dedicated to Meenakshi (Parvati), Sundareśvarar (Shiva), and Aḻagar (Vishnu).
Represents a theological confluence of Shaivism, Shaktism, and Vaishnavism.
Central to the ancient city of Madurai, mentioned in Tamil Sangam literature and 6th-century CE texts.
Identified as one of the Paadal Petra Sthalams, revered Shiva temples.
The west tower (gopuram) serves as the model for the Tamil Nadu State Emblem.
Early main portions and shrines were built by Pandyan Emperor Sadayavarman Kulasekaran I (1190–1205 CE).
Subsequent additions and reconstructions of gopurams were made by Maravarman Sundara Pandyan I and Maravarman Sundara Pandyan II.
timeline: 6th-century CE: Goddess temple mentioned in ancient texts.
6th-9th century CE: Revere in verses of Tamil Saiva Nayanars as one of the Paadal Petra Sthalams.
1190 CE–1205 CE: Pandyan Emperor Sadayavarman Kulasekaran I builds main portions of the Gopuram and Meenakshi Shrine.
1231: Maravarman Sundara Pandyan I builds a gopuram, later known as Sundara Pandya Thirukkopuram.
1238-1251: Maravarman Sundara Pandyan II builds Chitra gopuram.
important_figures: Sadayavarman Kulasekaran I (Pandyan Emperor, major builder)
Tamil Saiva Nayanars (revered the temple in their verses)
Maravarman Sundara Pandyan I (builder of a gopuram)
Maravarman Sundara Pandyan II (builder of Chitra gopuram)
applications: Primary site for Hindu worship and religious ceremonies.

A prominent cultural and historical landmark in Madurai.

current_status: The Arulmigu Meenakshi Sundareswarar Temple continues to be a prominent and active Hindu temple, serving as a major pilgrimage site and a central cultural landmark in Madurai, India.
